service.name: postAcctgTrans
service.description: Post an accounting transaction and track the posted amount in the open time periods configured for the organization. This service will ensure that there are open time periods defined for the transaction date and that the trial balance is zero.

service.name: reconcileGlAccount
service.description: Reconciles a GLAccount

service.name: postInvoiceToGl
service.description: Posts invoices to General Ledger, using the createAcctgTransAndEntries service from above.

service.name: postInvoiceWriteoffToGl
service.description: Posts written-off amount of invoice to General Ledger, using the createAcctgTransAndEntries service from above.

service.name: postPaymentToGl
service.description: Posts a payment to General Ledger.

service.name: postPaycheckToGl
service.description: Posts a paycheck to General Ledger. This is not meant to be called directly but from inside postPaymentToGl

service.name: getPaymentAccountAndParties
service.description: Gets the organization and transaction parties of a payment and the GL account of the payment.

service.name: matchPaymentInvoiceGlPosts
service.description: Check if the invoice's and payment's offsetting GL accounts are the same. If not, creates two accounting transaction entries to offset the two. If the payment is a disbursement, the PaymentApplication's amountApplied is posted as a Credit to the offsetting payment account and a Debit to the offsetting invoice account. For receipts, the amount is posted as a Debit to the offsetting payment account and a Credit to the offsetting invoice account. The result is the acctgTransId of this transaction, if created.

service.name: postInventoryVarianceToGl
service.description: Posts inventory variance transactions to the General Ledger.

service.name: postShipmentReceiptToGl
service.description: Posts a shipment receipt to GL: debit Inventory, credit Uninvoiced Item Receipt. Note this creates accounting transaction for every line item of a shipment received.

service.name: postShipmentToGl
service.description: Posts a shipment to GL: debit COGS, credit Inventory. Note this creates accounting transaction for every item issuance of a shipment.

service.name: postInventoryItemOwnerChange
service.description: Post inventory transaction to GL to record the change of the owner of the inventory item.

service.name: postInventoryItemStatusChange
service.description: Post inventory transaction to GL to record the status change of an inventory item. The entity InventoryStatusGlAccountType contains what GlAccountType will be used for each status transition. If the fromStatusId is null, then it is assumed to be On Order (INV_ON_ORDER). If a status change is not supported or has no GlAccountTypes defined, then this service assumes nothing is to be done.

service.name: opentaps.postInventoryItemAccountingTagChange
service.description: If any accounting tag of the InventoryItem change, it will post a "neutral" GL transaction to Debit and Credit INVENTORY_ACCOUNT of the InventoryItem current value. Only the debit entry is tagged using the old tags, and the credit transaction is tagged with the current inventory item tags.

service.name: opentaps.postInventoryItemValueAdjustment
service.description: If InventoryItem.unitCost is changed, it will post a GL transaction to Debit INVENTORY_VAL_ADJ and Credit INVENTORY_ACCOUNT of the InventoryItem.productId by the amount of the unitCost change * the quantity on hand of the inventory item (or 1.0 if it's serialized and Available). Unit cost change is calculated by referring to the most recent value in InventoryItemValueHistory which is *earlier* than the modification date of the InventoryItem itself. If no previous unit cost history is found, no GL posting will be made.

service.name: postRawMaterialIssuancesToGl
service.description: Posts raw materials inventory issuances (to a WorkEffort) to the GL: Debit WIP Inventory, Credit Raw Materials Inventory Note that this service runs at the production run task level and will post for all items on the WorkEffortInventoryAssign, not on the InventoryItem level. Returns a List of acctgTransId created.

service.name: postInventoryToWorkEffortAssignToGl
service.description: Posts inventory issuance (to a WorkEffort) of given quantity to the GL: Debit WIP Inventory, Credit Raw Materials Inventory. The WIP Inventory product is specified by finishedProductId and if it is not specified, then the service will attempt to look up a productoin run corresponding to the given workEffortId. If the quantity is not supplied, then the entire WorkEffortInventoryAssign.quantity is used.

service.name: postProductionRunCostVarianceToGl
service.description: Service to post a production run variance, only used if the organization uses standard costing. This is called after a production run is completed and posts the difference between the production run cost and the value of the inventory items produced.

service.name: postWorkEffortCostsToGl
service.description: Posts WorkEffort costs to the GL.

service.name: postInventoryProducedToGl
service.description: Posts inventory produced by a WorkEffort (production run) to the GL.

service.name: postRevertedProductionRunToGl
service.description: More process after reverting production run.

service.name: postForeignExchangeMatchingToGl
service.description: Posts foreign exchange gain/loss to General Ledger.

service.name: closeTimePeriod
service.description: Closes a particular time period for an organization. Generally, use closeAllTimePeriods.

service.name: closeAllTimePeriods
service.description: Closes all time periods which end on the date of the specified time period for an organization. Follows the exact sequence of WEEK, BIWEEK, MONTH, QUARTER, and YEAR

service.name: resetOrgGlAccountBalances
service.description: Resets all the postedBalance of GlAccountOrganization for an organization to 0.0 for REVENUE, INCOME, and EXPENSE GL accounts.

service.name: createAcctgTransAndEntries
service.description: Takes a list of AcctgTransEntry entries, verifies that the list of entries are valid (GL account and organizationParty exist), and then creates an AcctgTrans entry and stores all the AcctgTransEntries with the acctgTransId. Note that this does not actually check that the debits and credits balance out. The idea is that unbalanced transactions can be created here, but they will need to be created before they are actually posted, and a later posting service will actually check that the transaction is balanced.

service.name: updateAcctgTransEntry
service.description: Update an Entry to a AcctgTrans record

service.name: createGlReconciliationEntry
service.description: Add an Entry to a GlReconciliation

service.name: updatePostedAmountAcctgTrans
service.description: finds all AcctgTrans where isPosted=Y and sets the postedAmount to the sum of all the debit amounts for the accounting transaction
